name: Canvas Preparation
bob_ross_intro: Welcome! Today we're going to paint a beautiful scene together. Let's start by preparing our canvas with a thin layer of liquid white.
tips: Make sure your liquid white is thin and even
Have all your brushes clean and ready
Remember - we don't make mistakes, just happy accidents!

name: Begin Bright Sky
bob_ross_intro: Let's start with our bright sky in the background. Remember, we always work from the back forward.
tips: Don't overwork this area - it's supporting, not starring
Keep your strokes confident and decisive
There are no mistakes, only happy accidents.

name: Bright Sky - Core Glow
instruction: Let's start blocking in the bright sky - core glow. Load your 2-inch brush with a thin, dark mix. We're just establishing our values here - don't worry about details yet.
tips: Keep your paint thin at this stage
Don't be afraid of the dark - it creates depth
We don't make mistakes, we have happy accidents.

name: Bright Sky - Light Falloff
instruction: Time to build up our bright sky - light falloff. With your 2-inch brush, use blend outward. Work the paint into the canvas, blending with what's already there.
tips: Let each layer dry slightly before the next
Build up gradually - you can always add more
This is your world - you can do anything.

name: Bright Sky - Mid Values
instruction: Time to build up our bright sky - mid values. With your 1-inch brush, use transition zones. Work the paint into the canvas, blending with what's already there.
tips: Let each layer dry slightly before the next
Build up gradually - you can always add more
Take your time - there's no pressure.

name: Bright Sky - Dark Transition
instruction: Let's soften and blend our bright sky. Take your fan brush and use gentle feather edges. We're creating smooth transitions between our values.
tips: Take your time - there's no pressure.

name: Begin Ground
bob_ross_intro: Now let's bring in our ground. This is going to be so much fun.
tips: Don't overwork this area - it's supporting, not starring
Keep your strokes confident and decisive
Let's give this little friend some company.

name: Ground - Core Shadow
instruction: Let's start blocking in the ground - core shadow. Load your 1-inch brush with a thin, dark mix. We're just establishing our values here - don't worry about details yet.
tips: Keep your paint thin at this stage
Don't be afraid of the dark - it creates depth
Just let it happen naturally.

name: Ground - Shadow Variation
instruction: Time to build up our ground - shadow variation. With your filbert, use subtle form. Work the paint into the canvas, blending with what's already there.
tips: Let each layer dry slightly before the next
Build up gradually - you can always add more
This is your world - you can do anything.

name: Ground - Edge Transition
instruction: Time to build up our ground - edge transition. With your fan brush, use soft edges. Work the paint into the canvas, blending with what's already there.
tips: Let each layer dry slightly before the next
Build up gradually - you can always add more
This is your world - you can do anything.

name: Ground - Rim Light
instruction: Now for the magic - let's add highlights to our ground! Load just a little paint on your script liner. Less is more here - just touch where the light would naturally hit.
tips: Highlights are the icing on the cake
Use your brightest values sparingly
This is your world - you can do anything.

name: Begin Grass
bob_ross_intro: Now let's bring in our grass. This is going to be so much fun.
tips: Don't overwork this area - it's supporting, not starring
Keep your strokes confident and decisive
Let's get a little crazy here.

name: Grass - Core Shadow
instruction: Let's start blocking in the grass - core shadow. Load your 1-inch brush with a thin, dark mix. We're just establishing our values here - don't worry about details yet.
tips: Keep your paint thin at this stage
Don't be afraid of the dark - it creates depth
This is your world - you can do anything.

name: Grass - Shadow Variation
instruction: Time to build up our grass - shadow variation. With your filbert, use subtle form. Work the paint into the canvas, blending with what's already there.
tips: Let each layer dry slightly before the next
Build up gradually - you can always add more
Just let it happen naturally.

name: Grass - Edge Transition
instruction: Time to build up our grass - edge transition. With your fan brush, use soft edges. Work the paint into the canvas, blending with what's already there.
tips: Let each layer dry slightly before the next
Build up gradually - you can always add more
Let's give this little friend some company.

name: Grass - Rim Light
instruction: Now for the magic - let's add highlights to our grass! Load just a little paint on your script liner. Less is more here - just touch where the light would naturally hit.
tips: Highlights are the icing on the cake
Use your brightest values sparingly
That's a nice touch right there.

name: Final Touches & Sign
bob_ross_outro: There we go! Our painting is complete. Step back and admire your work. Remember, this is YOUR world - you created something beautiful today.
tips: Step back and view from a distance
Make any final value adjustments
Add your signature - you've earned it!
Most importantly - be proud of what you've created!
